sentences.english: Can you finish on your own?
Obviously the quizzes must be worked on your own.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这些随堂考必须由你独力完成。

sentences.english: Francis translated that French novel by himself.
sentences.chinese: 法兰西斯独力翻译那本文法文小说。

sentences.english: She had climbed out by herself and walked home.
sentences.chinese: 她独力爬出篮子，往家走去。

sentences.english: Mr. Smart raised his six children on a rural farm in eastern Washington State.
sentences.chinese: 史墨先生在东华盛顿州的农庄中独力抚养大六个孩子。

sentences.english: He created an all-English learning environment that allowed his English to improve quickly.
sentences.chinese: 独力打造出全英语的学习环境让他的英文进步飞快。

definition: It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
beyond one's reach or power (to do sth)
to work as one (idiom); united in a concerted effort/working hard together
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
